hint: Continuous progress of existence and events in the past, present, and future
The period of the Earth's revolution around the sun, typically measured as 365 days
Human beings in general or considered collectively
A method, style, or manner of doing something
A period of twenty-four hours, starting and ending at midnight
An adult human male
An object that one need not, cannot, or does not wish to give a specific name to
An adult human female
The condition that distinguishes organisms from inanimate objects, characterized by growth, reproduction, and consciousness
A young human being below the age of puberty
The planet Earth and all life upon it
An institution designed for the teaching of students under the direction of teachers
A political organization with a centralized government that exercises authority over a territory
A group consisting of parents and children living together in a household
A person who is studying at a school or college
A number of people or things that are located close together or considered as a unit
A nation with its own government, occupying a particular territory
A matter or situation regarded as unwelcome or harmful and needing to be dealt with and overcome
The end part of a person's arm beyond the wrist, including the palm, fingers, and thumb
A piece or segment of something such as an object, area, or concept
A specific point or area in physical space
A particular situation or example of something
A period of seven days, usually starting on Monday and ending on Sunday
A commercial business organization engaged in industrial, professional, or financial activities
A set of connected things or parts forming a complex whole, such as a network of structures or mechanisms
A planned series of activities or procedures to achieve a particular goal
A sentence worded or expressed so as to elicit information
Activity involving mental or physical effort done in order to achieve a purpose or result
The governing body of a nation, state, or community
An arithmetical value, expressed by a word, symbol, or figure, representing a particular quantity
The period of darkness in each twenty-four hours; the time from sunset to sunrise
A particular spot, place, or position in an area or on a scale
The place where one lives permanently, especially as a member of a family or household
A colorless, transparent, odorless liquid that forms the seas, lakes, rivers, and rain and is the basis of the fluids of living organisms
A space that can be occupied or where something can be done
A female parent who has given birth to or raised a child
A region or part of a town, a country, or the world
A current medium of exchange in the form of coins and banknotes; a currency
An account of imaginary or real people and events told for entertainment or informative purposes
A thing that is known or proved to be true
Each of the twelve named periods into which a year is divided
A large number or amount of people, things, or activities
In accordance with what is just, good, or proper; conforming to facts or truth
The devotion of time and attention to acquiring knowledge or skills
A written or printed work consisting of pages glued or sewn together along one side
The organ of sight, a sense or feeling, an ability to perceive or notice
A regular activity performed in exchange for payment, especially as one's trade, occupation, or profession
A single distinct meaningful element of speech or writing
An organization or economic system where goods and services are exchanged for one another or for money
An important topic or problem for debate or discussion
A position to the left or right of an object, place, or central point
A category of things distinguished by particular characteristics
The upper part of the human body, or a person in charge of a group
A building for human habitation, especially one that is lived in by a family or small group of people
An act of help, assistance, or providing something for someone
A person with whom one has a bond of mutual affection, typically one exclusive of sexual or family relations
A male parent who has begotten a child
The ability to do something or act in a particular way, often through control or influence
A period of time equal to a twenty-fourth part of a day and night
An activity or sport usually involving skill, knowledge, or chance, undertaken for enjoyment or competition
A long, narrow mark or band
The final part of something, especially a period of time, an activity, or a story
A person, animal, or plant that is part of a group or society
The system of rules recognized by a community as a binding action
A road vehicle, typically with four wheels, powered by an internal combustion engine
A large and densely populated urban area
A group of people living in the same place or having a particular characteristic in common
A word or set of words by which a person, animal, place, or thing is known, addressed, or referred to
The elected head of a republican country
A group of players forming one side in a competitive game or sport
A period of time equal to sixty seconds
A thought or suggestion as to a possible course of action
A child or young person
The physical structure of a person or an animal
Facts or details about a subject
The rear surface of the human body from the shoulders to the hips
A person's father or mother
The front part of a person's head, where the eyes, nose, and mouth are
People or things that are not the ones already mentioned
A relative position or rank on a scale or spectrum
A room, set of rooms, or building used as a place for commercial, professional, or administrative work
A hinged, sliding, or revolving barrier at the entrance to a building, room, or vehicle
The state of being free from illness or injury
A human being regarded as an individual
The expression or application of human creative skill and imagination
A state of armed conflict between different countries or different groups within a country
The study of past events, particularly in human affairs
A social gathering of invited guests, typically involving eating, drinking, and entertainment
A consequence, effect, or outcome of something
To make or become different
The early part of the day, from sunrise until about noon
The mental capacity to understand and form judgments by a process of logic
The systematic investigation into and study of materials and sources to establish facts and reach new conclusions
A female child
A man or a boy
A very brief period of time
The invisible gaseous substance surrounding the earth, a mixture mainly of oxygen and nitrogen
A person who educates students or pupils
Strength or energy as an attribute of physical action or movement
The process of receiving or giving systematic instruction, especially at a school or university
